title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 3000.20 - Judicial review
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 3000.20 - Judicial review

State Regulations
A decision of the tribunal which is not subject to any
further administrative review shall irrevocably decide all the issues which
were raised in the proceeding, unless within four months after the issuance of
such decision by the tribunal and the giving of notice of such decision to the
parties, the petitioner applies for judicial review in the manner provided by
article 78 of the Civil Practice Law and Rules. Appeals from tribunal decisions
shall go directly to the Appellate Division of the Supreme Court, Third

Department, but in all respects the provisions and standards of article 78
shall apply. The tribunal may, in its discretion, certify to such Appellate

Division of the Supreme Court questions of law involved in its
decision. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20
ยง
3000.20

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
